intro: Angelica kaghanica, commonly known as the Tibetan angelica, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, hollow stems and large, compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often harvested for their aromatic and medicinal properties. Angelica kaghanica thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat.
